name: Dale Barton

topics.response_text: So you're the visitor I've heard some of the Legionaries talking about. If you're in the mood to trade, just say the word.
He's the best the Legion has to offer, or so the Legionaries say. Brute of man, wears a fancy metal mask into battle.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to know more about you.
Are you part of the Legion?
topics.response_text: No, sir. I'm an independent trader from Arizona.

topics.topic_text: Is it dangerous to trade with the Legion?
topics.response_text: Not at all - they're my best customers. As long as you don't try to sell 'em chems or alcohol, they treat you fair.

topics.topic_text: Do you ever trade with the NCR?
topics.response_text: Between having to hire protection and getting slapped with taxes, it's more profitable to stick to Arizona and New Mexico.
I haven't had the pleasure. I have crossed paths with Legate Lanius, his second-in-command, however. It was... unpleasant.

topics.topic_text: Show me what you have for sale.

conversation.response_text: Here I was thinking you'd be a challenge, want a rematch?.

description:
Dale Barton is a 48 year-old Caucasian Male.

Dale Barton is an independent caravan merchant who operates primarily in the Mojave Wasteland, serving as a crucial supplier for Caesar's Legion. Based at The Fort, he handles the distribution of goods and resources that support the Legion's operations in the region.

Dale Barton's Personality: Pragmatic and self-reliant, Dale Barton maintains a neutral stance in the wasteland's conflicts. He values business relationships above ideological loyalties, though his service to Caesar's Legion has made him wary of outsiders and potential spies. He speaks plainly and prefers to focus on transactions rather than political discussions.

Dale Barton's Backstory: Born and raised in Arizona before the Great War, Dale Barton survived the apocalypse through his wits and adaptability. He established himself as a caravan merchant in the decades following the war, gradually building a network of trade routes and contacts. His reputation for reliability and fair dealing caught the attention of Caesar's Legion recruiters, who approached him to serve as a supplier for their expansion into the Mojave Wasteland. Seeing an opportunity for profit and security, Dale accepted the position, establishing his operations at The Fort where he continues to manage the flow of goods to support the Legion's campaign.
